item.title: The Book of Five Rings
item.description: In many areas of life, but particularly martial arts, an overemphasis is placed on technique, showmanship and equipment. The martial arts that Musashi1 teach are simple, direct and practical.

item.title: A Wizard of Earthsea
item.description: A young man discovers his knack for magic when he saves the people of his village from an invading force. He is sent to a school of magic, but in his arrogance and haste to prove himself summons a dark shadow of his own power which sets itself against him.

item.title: Breaking Things At Work
item.description: Luddism has been unfairly painted as technophobic; in reality it identified that technology is a political tool used to control and exploit labour, that can and should be resisted.

item.title: Capitalism And The Sea
item.description: In Marx’s conception of industrial capitalism as Exploitative and alienating production of goods The realisation of value through trade and the resulting accumulation of capital the sea is both a site of production (fishing) and a medium for circulation (shipping).

item.title: Happy
item.description: I read this before I started doing chapter summaries, but I got a lot from this book and it is well worth the time.

item.title: Liberalism At Large
item.description: A detailed overview of historically dominant strains of liberalism, as embodied by the editors of the Economist. This liberalism is identified with:

item.title: Logical Chess: Move By Move
item.description: Notes Introduction Playing precisely, without analysis paralysis, requires positional judgement Simply: if I put my pieces on the best squares, I will probably win Decisive combinations will appear on the board

item.title: Rivers Of London
item.description: A newly-minted PC encounters a ghost while doing grunt work on a murder case, and soon becomes an apprentice in the magical wing of the Metropolitan Police.

item.title: Terminal Boredom
item.description: This is a selection of science fiction short stories published in Japan between the 1960s and 1980s. Where I can find a publishing year I’ve included it.

item.title: The Art of Learning
item.description: Summary The book is partly an overview of Waitzkin’s successful careers as a high-level chess player and martial artist, partly a philosophical treatise on the nature of learning.

item.title: The Emancipated Spectator
item.description: The book is a ‘critique of’ critique of the spectacle, described as the belief that the bombardment of images and spectacles has rendered democractic subjects passive and ignorant.

item.title: The Farthest Shore
item.description: A young prince, heir to a long-empty throne, comes to the island of mages with word that magic is failing. He and the archmage set out across the sea to investigate, finding at the edges of the world the fatal consequences of mages’ misled desires to cheat death.

item.title: The Murder on the Links
item.description: Poirot and Hastings, along with an arrogant Parisian detective, investigate the murder of a rich man under seemingly familiar circumstances. The solution lies in recalling this infamous crime and unravelling the man’s son’s love life.

item.title: The Mysterious Affair At Styles
item.description: While visiting the home of some friends, Mr. Hastings not only witnesses a murder by poisoning but also runs into his friend, the acclaimed Belgian detective Poirot.

item.title: The Tombs Of Atuan
item.description: A young girl is taken from her home and stripped of her name and identity to serve the Nameless Gods of the Kargish empire.

item.title: Toki Pona: The Language Of Good
item.description: Sonja Lang introduces a microlanguage structured around minimalism and mindful awareness of the present. As an educational text, the quality of exercises is really high and the ideas are expressed clearly.

item.title: Tomorrow Sex Will Be Good Again
item.description: Katherine Angel posits that consent is not enough, that while positive consent is the “least bad standard” for sexual assault legislation, it isn’t equipped to make “sex good again”.
